Package com.example.eventapp.viewmodels

Class ProfileViewModel

java.lang.Object
androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
com.example.eventapp.viewmodels.ProfileViewModel
public class ProfileViewModel extends androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
ProfileViewModel is a ViewModel that manages and interacts with the data needed for the user profile screen. It interfaces with repositories to manage user and facility information, observing changes and exposing LiveData for facilities, users, and the current logged-in user.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ProfileViewModel()
    Initialization of the ViewModel, getting both userRepository and facilityRepository for later use Then, it takes the current User's live data from the userRepository, which is what the ViewModel primarily operates with, and sets a forever observer on it
    ProfileViewModel(UserRepository userRepository, FacilityRepository facilityRepository, androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<User> injectedLiveData)
    Initializes ProfileViewModel, but allows you to pre-specify the repositories for testing purposes

    • updateUser

      public CompletableFuture<Void> updateUser(String name, String email, String phone, boolean optNotifs, boolean isOrganizer, String photoUriString)
      Updates a user in the user repository with new information
      Parameters:
      name - The new name of the user
      email - The new email of the user
      phone - The new phone number of the user
      optNotifs - Whether or not the user opts out of notifications
      isOrganizer - Whether or not the user is an organizer
      photoUriString - The Uri string of the newly updated photo

    • addFacility

      public CompletableFuture<String> addFacility(Facility facility)
      Adds a facility to the repository, which then updates the database
      Parameters:
      facility - The facility to add to the repository

    • setSelectedFacility

      public void setSelectedFacility(Facility facility)
      Sets the currently selected Facility, for use in communication between fragments
      Parameters:
      facility - The Facility to select

    • getSelectedFacility

      public Facility getSelectedFacility()
      Gets the currently selected Facility, for use in communication between fragments If no facility is selected, it will run newSelectedFacility() instead
      Returns:
      The currently selected Facility
